Technical expertise: Another challenge is the lack of technical expertise in developing countries. This can make it difficult to design and implement effective water treatment systems.
Political instability: Political instability can also be a major obstacle in establishing a clean water initiative. This can make it difficult to secure funding and implement projects.
Cultural resistance: In some cases, cultural resistance to change can also be a problem. This can make it difficult to convince people to adopt new water treatment technologies.
Environmental impact: The environmental impact of water treatment systems can also be a concern. This can make it difficult to secure funding and implement projects.

Maintenance and sustainability: Once a clean water initiative is established, it is important to ensure that it is properly maintained and sustainable. This can be challenging due to the lack of resources and technical expertise in many developing countries.
